  • View page source

Saving and Loading Networks

For deploying an SNS-Network, it is often advantageous to compile the network as a model, and then save it for later use. This is particularly important when compiling networks using the 'sparse' compiler option, as these networks take long periods of time to compile. File structure is currently based around python’s pickle format.

Saving a Network

When saving networks, we call the save method of sns_toolbox and pass in the model and a desired file name. The convention within SNS-Toolbox is to save compiled networks as .sns files.

import sns_toolbox
from sns_toolbox.networks import Network

net = Network()
model = net.compile(backend='numpy', dt=0.1)

# Save the network
sns_toolbox.save(model, 'save_example.sns')

Loading a Network

When loading a network, we can call the load method of sns_toolbox.

model_loaded = sns_toolbox.load('save_example.sns')

Once the model is loaded, it behaves exactly the same as the original network, compiled to a specific backend.
